intro: Cyrtandra montis-loa, commonly known as the mountain-loa cyrtandra, is a member of the Gesneriaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to the tropical regions of the Pacific, particularly found in Hawaii. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are typically showy, with five petals that range in color from white to pink or red. Cyrtandra montis-loa plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing nectar for native pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of the region.
